item.title: Report I-2023060060
item.description:
Report I-2023060060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-14T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: Tonkawa
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EVANS DELIVERY COMPANY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 2030- Mr. Girard arrived on-site and found the trailer. The team entered the trailer with Level D PPE and air-purifying respirators. Once inside, the team found that the drums had shifted forward. The team started pulling the drums to the back of the trailer and inspecting them. The team found the an area of impacted floor that was approximately 6' x 8'. The team found two(2) drums that had large dents in them with wet product underneath them. They were not actively Ieaking. The team Ioosened the bungs and they began to leak from the bottom ring. The team overpacked the two(2) drums and cleaned the floor using clay absorbents. The team moved and inspected the remaining drums. They found no evidence of any other Ieaking drums. 2230- The team placed the drums back into position and secured the load with the drivefs assistance. It is believed that when the drums shifted, the bottom rings were damaged, causing a small tear in the plastic drum on the bottom. The two(2) drums that were overpacked were left on the trailer to be delivered by Evans. The spent absorbents to clean the floor were placed into a 55-gallon drum. Once the trailer was cleaned and reloaded, the team remediated the impacted gravel parking lot. The impacted area was approximately l'x 10'. The team hand dug the impacted gravel and placed it into the 55-gallon drum with the spent absorbents. The team also cleaned the side of the trailer. The team generated one(1) 55-gallon drum of nonhazardous solid waste.

  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: This incident involved a Truck and tank trailer. This tanker was loaded from another tanker. After completion of loading, the driver was taking a break. During his break he was notified that he had a small drip coming from the tanker. The drip was contained. An emergency response crew was dispatched to the scene to determine the issue and clean up the spill. They determined that the internal valve flange had a loose bolt. They tightened the bolt and stopped the drip. They finished the clean up. Load was transported on to destination.

item.title: Report E-2023060121
item.description:
Report E-2023060121

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-14T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: ROLAND
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck and loaded tank trailer in route to Pryor Ok. When truck pulled into the Oklahoma weigh station, it was observed that there was a drip coming from the internal valve area on the tanker. The weigh station moved the tanker to a containment area. It was later determined that a faulty internal gasket caused the leak. The fire department responded to contain the leak. An emergency response and remediation crew were dispatched to the scene in order to transfer of the load into another tank trailer and perform the necessary clean up and remediation of the site. The load was successfully transferred into another tanker and transported to destination. The cleanup and remediation of the site have been completed.

  • Description: RMP WAS PERFORMING AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT SHIPPER AUDIT AND DISCOVERED PACKAGES THAT DID NOT HAVE ANY HAZARDOUS OUTER MARKINGS BUT BASED ON THE SDS SHEETS INSIDE THE PACKAGES THE PACKAGES SHOULD HAVE HAD OUTER HAZARDOUS MARKINGS. THE BOXES WERE SENT TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA AND REPORTED TO THE UPS HAZMAT COMPLIANCE CENTER. THIS PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE AN SDS INSIDE BUT THE SDS WAS FOUND BY THE RESPONDER AND SECTION 14 STATED THIS PRODUCT WAS REGULATED. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1ZBH47320315671677, 1ZBH47320328307582, AND 1ZBH47320307299854.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LOO experienced a UN3082 Gunslinger P+D release from a 275-gallon poly tote due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 20' x 30' area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (4) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LTU experienced a release of UN3082 SR351 H release from a 55-gallon metal drum. XPO terminal personnel attempted to place the damaged 55-gallon metal drum into a 55-gallon poly drum, the drum got stuck, and contractor assistance was required. Contractors arrived onsite and were unable to determine the cause of release nor the amount released as XPO had completed cleanup. The crew removed the drum from the 55-gallon poly and placed it into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The damaged 55-gallon poly was cut up and containerized along with impacted oil dri into a separate 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023050178
item.description:
Report E-2023050178

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-14T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: SAYRE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FRONTIER TANK LINES INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 03, 2023, Frontier Tank Lines contacted ERTS to report that Unit #206072 was involved in a rollover accident that released diesel fuel near Exit #26 I-40 in Sayre, OK. The exact quantity of diesel was unknown at that time, but the caller stated that an estimated fifty yards of the surface had been impacted. The driver was no longer on the scene, but the local fire department was on site. No drains or waterways were reported to have been impacted. On May 03, 2023, ERS of OK was dispatched to the site with a vac truck. Trooper Bussy, informed ERTS that there was a 15 ft-by-15 ft area of soil impacted with diesel that was about 10 in deep. Before the contractor arrived with the vac truck, the local fire departments hazmat team was on site and would manage the tanker and truck being uprighted. At 0600 ERS arrived onsite to begin evaluating the release. At 0700 ET, ERS utilized their vac truck to evacuate the standing pool, which was at capacity with 2800 gallons onboard, a second vac truck was called for to remove all standing liquid. While waiting for the second vac truck the crew placed an absorbent boom down to secure the area for future excavation. At 1200 ET, the second vac truck arrived so the crew continued to collect the material. At 1400 ET, ERS updated the site assessment of the impacted soil area being 300ft of a ditch and from 10ft to 1ft back and forth. The main area that was impacted measured 200ft long and was estimated 15 -30ft wide. At 1500 ET, ERS completed all ER clean-up on May 4, 2023. The scene was staged with a poly tarp, and multiple booms below the impacted soil. The area was flagged and is currently secure until further remediation is scheduled to recover the impacted soil.

item.title: Report E-2023050173
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-05
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 5, 2023, at 0551 ET, XPO Logistics terminal LTU suffered a cargo related release of UN3266 Principal to the trailer floor and asphalt lot below. . ERTS dispatched ERS of OK to investigate, secure and remediate the release. On May 5, 2023, at 0846 ET, ERS personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released to a 5' x 10' area of the trailer floor and a 10' x 20' area of the asphalt lot under the trailer due to a forklift puncture. Oil Dri was deployed, and citric acid utilized to neutralize the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack and the cleanup debris was containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-13T21:09:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-15
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal LOO experienced a release of UN3266 Super Quest No. 278 from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of UN3266 Super Quest released to a 10' x 10' area of the dock floor. The drum was damaged due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. Citric acid was then utilized to neutralize the area. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-17
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal LTU called in to report an estimated 40-gallon spill of UN3082 DUB SYNERSOL from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a puncture on the bottom from an unknown source that has impacted their trailer floor and the asphalt beneath it. ERTS dispatched a contractor for cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to an 8' x 10' area of the trailer floor, an 6' x 6' area of the dock, and a 8' x 10' area of the concrete lot below the trailer. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged drum and all cleanup debris were collected into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On August 11, 2022, Landstar called ERTS to report a propane tank that holds 500 gallons had a leaking valve. No storm drains or waterways were impacted. Basin Environmental departed the site and no waste was generated.
